metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for UK Ancestry

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for UK Ancestry

1.   UKA 1.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay on the UK Ancestry route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows: 
    1.   (a) for entry clearance, form “UK Ancestry, Right of Abode or Returning Residents visa”; or
    2.   (b) for permission to stay, form “Application to extend stay in the UK: FLR(IR)”.

1.   UKA 1.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the UK Ancestry route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality.

UKA 1.3. The applicant must be a Commonwealth citizen.

UKA 1.4. If applying for entry clearance, the applicant must be aged 17 or over on the date of their intended arrival in the UK.

UKA 1.5. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.

UKA 1.5A. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must have previously been granted permission on the UK Ancestry route as a person with UK Ancestry.

UKA 1.6. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for the UK Ancestry route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants must apply online for UK Ancestry, meet fee, biometrics, and identity requirements, and be Commonwealth citizens aged 17+ (if applying for entry clearance) or already in the UK with prior permission (if extending stay). Applications failing these criteria will be rejected.
chunks.augmented_text:

Summary: Applicants must apply online for UK Ancestry, meet fee, biometrics, and identity requirements, and be Commonwealth citizens aged 17+ (if applying for entry clearance) or already in the UK with prior permission (if extending stay). Applications failing these criteria will be rejected.

### Validity requirements for UK Ancestry

1.   UKA 1.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay on the UK Ancestry route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows: 
    1.   (a) for entry clearance, form “UK Ancestry, Right of Abode or Returning Residents visa”; or
    2.   (b) for permission to stay, form “Application to extend stay in the UK: FLR(IR)”.

1.   UKA 1.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the UK Ancestry route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality.

UKA 1.3. The applicant must be a Commonwealth citizen.

UKA 1.4. If applying for entry clearance, the applicant must be aged 17 or over on the date of their intended arrival in the UK.

UKA 1.5. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.

UKA 1.5A. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must have previously been granted permission on the UK Ancestry route as a person with UK Ancestry.

UKA 1.6. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for the UK Ancestry route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for UK Ancestry

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for UK Ancestry

UKA 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   UKA 2.2. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking UK Ancestry permission must not breach immigration laws or be on bail, except where overstaying is disregarded under specific exceptions.

### Suitability requirements for UK Ancestry

UKA 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   UKA 2.2. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.

metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for UK Ancestry

chunks.text: ### Eligibility requirements for UK Ancestry
chunks.summary: Applicants must demonstrate a commonwealth nationality, be aged 17 or over, and intend to take or seek employment in the UK. They must also meet financial and other specified criteria, with exceptions or additional conditions outlined for certain circumstances.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix UK Ancestry
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK Ancestry
Section ID: Eligibility requirements for UK Ancestry
Section: Eligibility requirements for UK Ancestry
Topic: eligibility

Summary: Applicants must demonstrate a commonwealth nationality, be aged 17 or over, and intend to take or seek employment in the UK. They must also meet financial and other specified criteria, with exceptions or additional conditions outlined for certain circumstances.

### Eligibility requirements for UK Ancestry

metadata.section_title: Entry requirements for UK Ancestry

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for UK Ancestry

UKA 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK on the UK Ancestry route must apply for and obtain entry clearance on the UK Ancestry route before they arrive in the UK.

UKA 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance on the UK Ancestry route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking UK Ancestry must obtain entry clearance before arriving, including providing a tuberculosis screening certificate if required.
chunks.augmented_text:

Summary: Applicants seeking UK Ancestry must obtain entry clearance before arriving, including providing a tuberculosis screening certificate if required.

### Entry requirements for UK Ancestry

UKA 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK on the UK Ancestry route must apply for and obtain entry clearance on the UK Ancestry route before they arrive in the UK.

UKA 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance on the UK Ancestry route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

metadata.section_title: Grandparent born in the UK or Islands requirement

chunks.text:
### Grandparent born in the UK or Islands requirement

UKA 4.1. The applicant must have a grandparent born in the UK or Islands.
chunks.summary: Applicants must prove that at least one grandparent was born in the UK or Islands to qualify under UKA 4.1; this requirement applies universally without specific exceptions.

### Grandparent born in the UK or Islands requirement

UKA 4.1. The applicant must have a grandparent born in the UK or Islands.

metadata.section_title: Financial requirement for UK Ancestry

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for UK Ancestry

UKA 5.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant can and will adequately maintain and accommodate themselves, and any dependants in the UK, or applying for entry clearance, without recourse to public funds.

UKA 5.2. Funds must be shown as specified in Appendix Finance.

UKA 5.3. In assessing whether the applicant meets the financial requirement in UKA 5.1, the decision maker may take into account credible promises of financial support from a third party, such as a relative or friend of the applicant.
chunks.summary: Applicants for UK Ancestry must demonstrate they can adequately support and accommodate themselves without relying on public funds, using funds as specified in Appendix Finance. Credible promises of financial support from third parties may also be considered.

### Financial requirement for UK Ancestry

UKA 5.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant can and will adequately maintain and accommodate themselves, and any dependants in the UK, or applying for entry clearance, without recourse to public funds.

UKA 5.2. Funds must be shown as specified in Appendix Finance.

UKA 5.3. In assessing whether the applicant meets the financial requirement in UKA 5.1, the decision maker may take into account credible promises of financial support from a third party, such as a relative or friend of the applicant.

metadata.section_title: Work requirement for UK Ancestry

chunks.text:
### Work requirement for UK Ancestry

UKA 6.1. The applicant must be able to work and intend to seek and take employment in the UK.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying under UK Ancestry must demonstrate the ability and intention to seek and undertake employment in the UK; no specific employment sectors or job types are specified, but active engagement in employment is required.

metadata.section_title: Parental consent requirement for UK Ancestry applicant aged under 18

chunks.text:
### Parental consent requirement for UK Ancestry applicant aged under 18

1.   UKA 7.1. The applicant must meet the parental consent requirement for an applicant not applying as a dependent child in Appendix Children .

1.   UKA 7.2. DELETED.
chunks.summary: Applicants under 18 applying for UK Ancestry must obtain parental consent unless qualifying as a dependent child under the Children Appendix. This requirement ensures minors’ legal approval before application, with certain exceptions outlined in the rules.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application for UK Ancestry

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application for UK Ancestry

UKA 8.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements are met for UK Ancestry, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

UKA 8.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking UK Ancestry. A decision will be granted if all suitability and eligibility criteria are met; otherwise, the application is refused, with a right to Administrative Review.

UKA 8.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Period of grant on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 9.1. The applicant will be granted permission for 5 years.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying under the UK Ancestry route will be granted permission for a period of 5 years, subject to compliance with relevant conditions.

### Period of grant on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 9.1. The applicant will be granted permission for 5 years.

metadata.section_title: Conditions of grant on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 9.2. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work is permitted (including self-employment); and
    3.   (c) voluntary work is permitted; and
    4.   (d) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS.
    5.   (e) DELETED
chunks.summary: Applicants under the UK Ancestry route must not access public funds, are permitted to work (including self-employment) and voluntary work, and may study subject to ATAS requirements; these conditions apply to ensure compliance during their stay.

metadata.section_id: Settlement on the UK Ancestry route
metadata.section_title: Settlement on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text: ### Settlement on the UK Ancestry route
chunks.summary: This provision applies to individuals seeking settlement on the UK Ancestry route. It requires applicants to satisfy specified residence, ancestry, and other eligibility criteria; failure to meet these conditions may result in application rejection or refusal of settlement. There are no additional exceptions beyond the standard eligibility thresholds.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix UK Ancestry
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK Ancestry
Section ID: Settlement on the UK Ancestry route
Section: Settlement on the UK Ancestry route
Topic: settlement

Summary: This provision applies to individuals seeking settlement on the UK Ancestry route. It requires applicants to satisfy specified residence, ancestry, and other eligibility criteria; failure to meet these conditions may result in application rejection or refusal of settlement. There are no additional exceptions beyond the standard eligibility thresholds.

### Settlement on the UK Ancestry route

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 10.1. A person on the UK Ancestry route who is applying for settlement must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form “Settle in the UK in various immigration categories: form SET(O)”.

1.   UKA 10.2. An application for settlement must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be in the UK.

UKA 10.3. The applicant must be a Commonwealth citizen on the date of application.

UKA 10.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for settlement on the UK Ancestry route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants on the UK Ancestry route applying for settlement must submit an online application, pay fees, provide biometrics and valid travel documents, and be in the UK as a Commonwealth citizen. Failure to meet these conditions may result in rejection.

1.   UKA 10.2. An application for settlement must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be in the UK.

UKA 10.3. The applicant must be a Commonwealth citizen on the date of application.

UKA 10.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for settlement on the UK Ancestry route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Suitability Requirements for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Suitability Requirements for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 11.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   UKA 11.2. The applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying for settlement via the UK Ancestry route must meet suitability criteria, including not breaching immigration laws (excluding permitted overstays) or being on bail. They must also satisfy Part Suitability requirements to avoid refusal.

metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Eligibility requirements for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 12.1. The applicant must continue to meet the eligibility requirements of UKA 4.1 to UKA 6.1.

metadata.section_title: Qualifying period requirement for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Qualifying period requirement for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 13.1. The applicant must have spent 5 years in the UK with permission on the UK Ancestry route as a person with UK Ancestry.
chunks.summary: Applicants on the UK Ancestry route must have completed a continuous five-year period of lawful residence in the UK under this route to qualify for settlement; there are no specified exceptions.

metadata.section_title: Continuous residence requirement for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Continuous residence requirement for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 14.1. The applicant must meet the continuous residence requirement in Appendix Continuous Residence during the period in UKA 13.1.

metadata.section_title: English language requirement for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### English language requirement for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 15.1. Unless an exemption applies, the applicant must show English language ability on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages in speaking and listening to at least level B1.

UKA 15.2. The applicant must show they meet the English language requirement as specified in Appendix English Language.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking settlement via the UK Ancestry route must, unless exempt, demonstrate at least B1 level speaking and listening English language proficiency under the CEFR. Exemptions may apply, and compliance with Appendix English Language is required.

UKA 15.1. Unless an exemption applies, the applicant must show English language ability on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages in speaking and listening to at least level B1.

UKA 15.2. The applicant must show they meet the English language requirement as specified in Appendix English Language.

metadata.section_title: Knowledge of life in the UK requirement for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Knowledge of life in the UK requirement for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 16.1. The applicant must meet the knowledge of Life in the UK requirement as specified in Appendix KOL UK.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying for settlement on the UK Ancestry route must demonstrate knowledge of life in the UK as specified in Appendix KOL UK; meeting this requirement is essential for approval.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application for settlement on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 17.1. If the decision maker is satisfied all the suitability and eligibility requirements are met for settlement on the UK Ancestry route, the applicant will be granted settlement, otherwise the application will be refused.

UKA 17.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

UKA 17.1. If the decision maker is satisfied all the suitability and eligibility requirements are met for settlement on the UK Ancestry route, the applicant will be granted settlement, otherwise the application will be refused.

UKA 17.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Dependants of a person with UK Ancestry

chunks.text: ### Dependants of a person with UK Ancestry
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependants of individuals with UK Ancestry seeking to join or remain in the UK. Dependants must meet requirements such as proving genuine relationship and, in some cases, financial or maintenance thresholds. Exceptions or specific conditions are not detailed in this excerpt.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix UK Ancestry
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK Ancestry
Section ID: UKA 1.1
Section: Dependants of a person with UK Ancestry
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to dependants of individuals with UK Ancestry seeking to join or remain in the UK. Dependants must meet requirements such as proving genuine relationship and, in some cases, financial or maintenance thresholds. Exceptions or specific conditions are not detailed in this excerpt.

### Dependants of a person with UK Ancestry

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 18.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows: 
    1.   (a) for entry clearance, “Join or accompany a family member” on the “Find and apply for other visas from outside the UK” form; or
    2.   (b) for permission to stay, form “Application to extend stay in the UK: FLR(IR)”.

1.   UKA 18.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child of a person on the UK Ancestry route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be applying as partner or child of a person who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the UK Ancestry route that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission to stay on the UK Ancestry route; or
        3.   (iii) is settled or has become a British citizen, providing that person (P) had permission on the UK Ancestry route when they settled.

1.   UKA 18.3. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.
2.   UKA 18.3ZA. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must not have, or have last been granted, permission: 
    1.   (a) as a Visitor; or
    2.   (b) as a Short-term Student; or
    3.   (c) as a Parent of a Child Student; or
    4.   (d) as a Seasonal Worker; or
    5.   (e) as a Domestic Worker in a Private Household; or
    6.   (f) outside the Immigration Rules.

1.   UKA 18.3A. An applicant who is applying for permission to stay and has, or last had, permission as a Student, must fulfil one of the Conditions A or B below on the date of application: 
    1.   (a) Condition A: the applicant must have completed the course of study for which the Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies was assigned (or a course to which ST 27.3 of Appendix Student applies); or
    2.   (b) Condition B: the applicant must: 
        1.   (i) be studying a full-time course of study leading to the award of a PhD with a higher education provider which has a track record of compliance; and
        2.   (ii) have completed at least 24 months of study on that course.

UKA 18.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Dependents (partners or children) of UK Ancestry visa holders must apply online, pay applicable fees and health charges, provide biometrics and valid travel documents, and have a qualifying relationship to someone on the UK Ancestry route. The applicant’s sponsor must have a valid, pending, or settled UK Ancestry status at the time of application.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix UK Ancestry
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK Ancestry
Section ID: 1
Section: Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route
Topic: leave-to-enter

Summary: Dependents (partners or children) of UK Ancestry visa holders must apply online, pay applicable fees and health charges, provide biometrics and valid travel documents, and have a qualifying relationship to someone on the UK Ancestry route. The applicant’s sponsor must have a valid, pending, or settled UK Ancestry status at the time of application.

### Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 18.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows: 
    1.   (a) for entry clearance, “Join or accompany a family member” on the “Find and apply for other visas from outside the UK” form; or
    2.   (b) for permission to stay, form “Application to extend stay in the UK: FLR(IR)”.

1.   UKA 18.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child of a person on the UK Ancestry route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be applying as partner or child of a person who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the UK Ancestry route that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission to stay on the UK Ancestry route; or
        3.   (iii) is settled or has become a British citizen, providing that person (P) had permission on the UK Ancestry route when they settled.

1.   UKA 18.3. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.
2.   UKA 18.3ZA. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must not have, or have last been granted, permission: 
    1.   (a) as a Visitor; or
    2.   (b) as a Short-term Student; or
    3.   (c) as a Parent of a Child Student; or
    4.   (d) as a Seasonal Worker; or
    5.   (e) as a Domestic Worker in a Private Household; or
    6.   (f) outside the Immigration Rules.

1.   UKA 18.3A. An applicant who is applying for permission to stay and has, or last had, permission as a Student, must fulfil one of the Conditions A or B below on the date of application: 
    1.   (a) Condition A: the applicant must have completed the course of study for which the Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies was assigned (or a course to which ST 27.3 of Appendix Student applies); or
    2.   (b) Condition B: the applicant must: 
        1.   (i) be studying a full-time course of study leading to the award of a PhD with a higher education provider which has a track record of compliance; and
        2.   (ii) have completed at least 24 months of study on that course.

UKA 18.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 19.1. The suitability requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route are that they must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   UKA 19.2. The applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners or children on the UK Ancestry route must meet suitability criteria by not breaching immigration laws (subject to overstaying exceptions) or being on immigration bail.

chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners and children applying under the UK Ancestry route. They must demonstrate genuine dependence and meet eligibility criteria, including relationship and suitability requirements. Exceptions may apply if they fail to meet specified conditions or if their circumstances do not align with the route’s thresholds.

### Eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

metadata.section_title: Entry requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Entry requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 20.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a partner or child must apply for and obtain an entry clearance as a partner or child before they arrive in the UK.

UKA 20.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners or children applying under the UK Ancestry route must obtain entry clearance before arrival. They must also provide TB screening proof if applicable, complying with medical certification requirements.

### Entry requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 20.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a partner or child must apply for and obtain an entry clearance as a partner or child before they arrive in the UK.

UKA 20.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirements for a partner on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirements for a partner on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 21.1. The applicant must be the partner of a person (P) and one of the following must apply: 
    1.   (a) P has permission on the UK Ancestry route; or
    2.   (b) P is, at the same time, applying for (and is granted) permission on the UK Ancestry route; or
    3.   (c) if the applicant is applying for permission to stay, P is settled or has become a British citizen, providing P had permission on the UK Ancestry route when they settled.

UKA 21.2. The requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

UKA 21.3. DELETED

UKA 21.4. DELETED
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners applying via the UK Ancestry route. The applicant must be the partner of someone with current or former UK Ancestry permission or settled status gained while on that route, meeting specific relationship criteria. Critical conditions include P's permission status and relationship requirements outlined in the relevant appendix.

metadata.section_title: Requirements for a dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Requirements for a dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 24A.1. The applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) relationship requirement: entry clearance and permission to stay; and
    2.   (b) care requirement; and
    3.   (c) age and independent life requirement.
chunks.summary: Dependent children applying via the UK Ancestry route must meet relationship, care, and age/independence requirements as specified in Appendix Children, with entry clearance and stay permission contingent on these conditions.

### Requirements for a dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 24A.1. The applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) relationship requirement: entry clearance and permission to stay; and
    2.   (b) care requirement; and
    3.   (c) age and independent life requirement.

metadata.section_title: Financial requirement for a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 25.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that there will be adequate maintenance and accommodation for the applicant, the person with UK Ancestry, and any other dependants in the UK, without recourse to public funds.

UKA 25.2. Funds must be shown as specified in Appendix Finance.

UKA 25.3. In assessing whether the applicant meets the financial requirement in UKA 25.1, the decision maker may take into account credible promises of financial support from a third party, such as a relative or friend of the applicant.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners or children on the UK Ancestry route. Applicants must demonstrate adequate maintenance and accommodation without recourse to public funds, with funds shown as per Appendix Finance. Credible promises of financial support from third parties may be considered.

### Financial requirement for a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 25.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that there will be adequate maintenance and accommodation for the applicant, the person with UK Ancestry, and any other dependants in the UK, without recourse to public funds.

UKA 25.2. Funds must be shown as specified in Appendix Finance.

UKA 25.3. In assessing whether the applicant meets the financial requirement in UKA 25.1, the decision maker may take into account credible promises of financial support from a third party, such as a relative or friend of the applicant.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application for a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application for a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 26.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements are met for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

UKA 26.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners and children applying under the UK Ancestry route. It requires the decision-maker to confirm all suitability and eligibility criteria are met for approval; otherwise, the application is refused, but applicants may request an Administrative Review.

### Decision on an application for a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 26.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements are met for a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

UKA 26.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 27.1. Unless UKA 27.2 applies, the applicant will be granted permission which ends on the same date as the person with UK Ancestry.

UKA 27.2. If the application is for permission to stay, and the person with UK Ancestry is being, or has been, granted settlement on the UK Ancestry route, or has become a British Citizen having previously had permission on the UK Ancestry route, the applicant will be granted permission to stay for 30 months.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners and children of UK Ancestry route applicants are granted permission until the same expiry as the principal applicant, unless the principal has settled or become a British citizen, in which case they receive a 30-month stay.

### Period of grant for a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 27.1. Unless UKA 27.2 applies, the applicant will be granted permission which ends on the same date as the person with UK Ancestry.

UKA 27.2. If the application is for permission to stay, and the person with UK Ancestry is being, or has been, granted settlement on the UK Ancestry route, or has become a British Citizen having previously had permission on the UK Ancestry route, the applicant will be granted permission to stay for 30 months.

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 27.3. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work (including self-employment and voluntary work) permitted; and
    3.   (c) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS.
    4.   (d) DELETED

metadata.section_title: Settlement by a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text: ### Settlement by a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners and children applying for settlement under the UK Ancestry route. They must demonstrate continued family relationship and meet the eligibility requirements; certain conditions or thresholds may apply, such as evidence of genuine dependency.

### Settlement by a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for settlement by a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for settlement by a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 28.1. A partner or child on the UK Ancestry route who is applying for settlement must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form “Settle in the UK in various immigration categories: form SET(O)”.

1.   UKA 28.2. An application for settlement must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided either a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be in the UK; and
    5.   (e) the applicant must be applying as a partner or child of a person (P) who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for settlement on the UK Ancestry route and that application has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) is settled or has become a British citizen, providing P had permission on the UK Ancestry route when they settled.

1.   UKA 28.3. The applicant must not have, or have last been granted, permission: 
    1.   (a) as a Visitor; or
    2.   (b) as a Short-term Student; or
    3.   (c) as a Parent of a Child Student; or
    4.   (d) as a Seasonal Worker; or
    5.   (e) as a Domestic Worker in a Private Household; or
    6.   (f) outside the Immigration Rules.

1.   UKA 28.3A. An applicant who has, or last had, permission as a Student, must fulfil one of the Conditions A or B below on the date of application: 
    1.   (a) Condition A: the applicant must have completed the course of study for which the Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies was assigned (or a course to which ST 27.3 of Appendix Student applies); or
    2.   (b) Condition B: the applicant must: 
        1.   (i) be studying a full-time course of study leading to the award of a PhD with a higher education provider which has a track record of compliance; and
        2.   (ii) have completed at least 24 months of study on that course.

UKA 28.4. An application which does not meet the validity requirements for settlement as a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners or children applying for settlement under the UK Ancestry route must submit an online application, paying fees, providing biometrics and proof of identity, and be in the UK. They must be linked to a sponsor with a valid or settled UK Ancestry application and must not have previous permission as a visitor, student, seasonal worker, or domestic worker.

    2.   (b) Condition B: the applicant must: 
        1.   (i) be studying a full-time course of study leading to the award of a PhD with a higher education provider which has a track record of compliance; and
        2.   (ii) have completed at least 24 months of study on that course.

UKA 28.4. An application which does not meet the validity requirements for settlement as a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for settlement by a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for settlement by a dependent partner and dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 29.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   UKA 29.2. The applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.

metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for settlement by a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Eligibility requirements for settlement by a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

Relationship requirement for settlement by a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 30.1. The applicant must be the partner or child of a person (P) where one of the following applies: 
    1.   (a) P is, at the same time, being granted settlement on the UK Ancestry route; or
    2.   (b) P is settled or has become a British citizen, providing P had permission on the UK Ancestry route when they settled.

UKA 30.2. If applying as a partner, the requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

UKA 30.3. DELETED

UKA 30.4. DELETED

UKA 30.5. If applying as a child, the applicant must meet the relationship requirement for settlement in Appendix Children.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners or children applying for settlement on the UK Ancestry route must be related to an individual who is either granted settlement or British citizenship under the route. Partners must also satisfy specific relationship criteria, and children must meet additional relationship requirements outlined in the relevant appendix.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix UK Ancestry
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK Ancestry
Section ID: Eligibility requirements for settlement by a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route
Section: Eligibility requirements for settlement by a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route
Topic: eligibility

Summary: Dependent partners or children applying for settlement on the UK Ancestry route must be related to an individual who is either granted settlement or British citizenship under the route. Partners must also satisfy specific relationship criteria, and children must meet additional relationship requirements outlined in the relevant appendix.

### Eligibility requirements for settlement by a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

Relationship requirement for settlement by a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 30.1. The applicant must be the partner or child of a person (P) where one of the following applies: 
    1.   (a) P is, at the same time, being granted settlement on the UK Ancestry route; or
    2.   (b) P is settled or has become a British citizen, providing P had permission on the UK Ancestry route when they settled.

UKA 30.2. If applying as a partner, the requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

UKA 30.3. DELETED

UKA 30.4. DELETED

UKA 30.5. If applying as a child, the applicant must meet the relationship requirement for settlement in Appendix Children.

metadata.section_title: Care requirement for settlement by a child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Care requirement for settlement by a child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 31.1. DELETED.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to children seeking settlement via the UK Ancestry route. It requires the parent or guardian to have provided proper care and support suitable for the child's wellbeing. There are no specific exceptions detailed in this excerpt.

metadata.section_title: Requirements for settlement as a dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Requirements for settlement as a dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 32A.1. The applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) care requirement; and
    2.   (b) age and independent life requirement.
chunks.summary: Dependent children applying for settlement on the UK Ancestry route must meet specific care and age/independent life requirements as outlined in Appendix Children, with eligibility contingent on satisfying these criteria.

Topic: settlement

Summary: Dependent children applying for settlement on the UK Ancestry route must meet specific care and age/independent life requirements as outlined in Appendix Children, with eligibility contingent on satisfying these criteria.

### Requirements for settlement as a dependent child on the UK Ancestry route

1.   UKA 32A.1. The applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) care requirement; and
    2.   (b) age and independent life requirement.

metadata.section_title: Financial requirement for settlement for a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for settlement for a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 33.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that there will be adequate maintenance and accommodation for the applicant, the person with UK Ancestry, and any other dependants in the UK, without recourse to public funds.

UKA 33.2. Funds must be shown as specified in Appendix Finance.

UKA 33.3. In assessing whether the applicant meets the financial requirement in UKA 33.1, the decision maker may take into account credible promises of financial support from a third party, such as a relative or friend of the applicant.
chunks.summary: Applicants on the UK Ancestry route must demonstrate adequate maintenance and accommodation in the UK without recourse to public funds. Funds must meet specified requirements, and credible third-party financial support may be considered.

### Financial requirement for settlement for a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 33.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that there will be adequate maintenance and accommodation for the applicant, the person with UK Ancestry, and any other dependants in the UK, without recourse to public funds.

UKA 33.2. Funds must be shown as specified in Appendix Finance.

UKA 33.3. In assessing whether the applicant meets the financial requirement in UKA 33.1, the decision maker may take into account credible promises of financial support from a third party, such as a relative or friend of the applicant.

metadata.section_title: English language requirement for settlement by a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### English language requirement for settlement by a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 34.1. Unless an exemption applies, the applicant must show English language ability on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages in speaking and listening of at least level B1.

UKA 34.2. The applicant must show they meet the English language requirement as specified in Appendix English Language.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying for settlement as a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route must demonstrate at least B1 level in speaking and listening English, unless exempted, as per Appendix English Language.

### English language requirement for settlement by a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 34.1. Unless an exemption applies, the applicant must show English language ability on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages in speaking and listening of at least level B1.

UKA 34.2. The applicant must show they meet the English language requirement as specified in Appendix English Language.

metadata.section_title: Knowledge of life in the UK requirement for settlement by a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Knowledge of life in the UK requirement for settlement by a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 35.1 If the applicant is aged 18 or over at the date of application, they must meet the Knowledge of Life in the UK requirement as set out in Appendix KOL UK.
chunks.summary: Applicants aged 18 or over applying for settlement on the UK Ancestry route must demonstrate knowledge of life in the UK as specified in Appendix KOL UK. This requirement is mandatory for all qualifying applicants without exceptions.

### Knowledge of life in the UK requirement for settlement by a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 35.1 If the applicant is aged 18 or over at the date of application, they must meet the Knowledge of Life in the UK requirement as set out in Appendix KOL UK.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application for settlement as a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application for settlement as a partner or child on the UK Ancestry route

UKA 36.1. If the decision maker is satisfied all the suitability and eligibility requirements are met for settlement as a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route the applicant will be granted settlement, otherwise the application will be refused.

UKA 36.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

Print this page
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking settlement as a dependent partner or child on the UK Ancestry route must meet all suitability and eligibility criteria; if satisfied, settlement is granted, otherwise refusal occurs. If refused, applicants may request an Administrative Review.

UKA 36.1. If the decision maker is satisfied all the suitability and eligibility requirements are met for settlement as a dependent partner or dependent child on the UK Ancestry route the applicant will be granted settlement, otherwise the application will be refused.

UKA 36.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
